feed.title: Current Watches, Warnings and Advisories for the United States Issued by the National Weather Service

entry.title: Flash Flood Warning issued March 16 at 9:24AM CDT until March 16 at 12:30PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: The National Weather Service in Birmingham has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Southwestern Chilton County in central Alabama... Northeastern Perry County in central Alabama... North Central Dallas County in south central Alabama... * Until 1230 PM CDT.

entry.title: Flood Advisory issued March 16 at 7:40AM CDT until March 16 at 12:30PM CDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1045 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of central Alabama, including the following county, Perry. * WHEN...Until 1045 AM CDT.

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued March 16 at 7:22AM PDT until March 17 at 11:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Surf of 4 to 6 feet with local sets to 7 feet and associated high rip current risk. * WHERE...San Diego County Coastal Areas and Orange County Coastal Areas. * WHEN...Through Thursday morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Orange County Coastal; San Diego County Coastal Areas

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued March 16 at 4:28AM PDT until March 16 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...North winds 20 to 30 mph with gusts up to 50 mph expected. Strongest in the mountains. * WHERE...Ventura County Mountains, Santa Clarita Valley and Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range. * WHEN...Until 9 AM PDT this morning.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Los Angeles County Mountains excluding the Santa Monica Range; Santa Clarita Valley; Ventura County Mountains

entry.title: Wind Advisory issued March 16 at 4:28AM PDT until March 16 at 9:00AM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM PDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...North winds 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * WHERE...San Fernando Valley. * WHEN...Until 9 AM PDT this morning. * IMPACTS...Gusty winds will blow around unsecured objects and make driving difficult, especially for high profile vehicles.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Los Angeles County San Fernando Valley

entry.title: Beach Hazards Statement issued March 16 at 3:47AM PDT until March 17 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...BEACH HAZARDS STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH THURSDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Dangerous rip currents and breaking waves of 4 to 6 feet with local sets to 7 feet. * WHERE...West facing beaches of the Los Angeles County Coast, and Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands.
entry.cap:areaDesc: Catalina and Santa Barbara Islands; Los Angeles County Coast including Downtown Los Angeles

entry.title: High Surf Advisory issued March 16 at 3:47AM PDT until March 17 at 3:00PM PDT by NWS
entry.summary: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM PDT THURSDAY... * WHAT...Large breaking waves of 10 to 15 feet with dangerous rip currents. * WHERE...West and northwest facing beaches of San Luis Obispo County Central Coast and Santa Barbara County Central Coast. * WHEN...Until 3 PM PDT Thursday.
entry.cap:areaDesc: San Luis Obispo County Central Coast; Santa Barbara County Central Coast

entry.summary: ...AREAS OF HEAVY SNOW THIS EVENING... .Snow will spread into the mountains this morning, with scattered rain showers developing on the plains this afternoon.
